travelTips: Arrive at the airport 3 hours early for international flights.
Carry a universal power adapter for UK plugs.
Learn a few basic French phrases to ease communication.
Pre-book museum tickets to avoid long lines in Paris.
Get a Japan Rail Pass before you travel to save on trains.
Carry cash — many places in Japan don’t accept cards.
Visit famous spots like Sagrada Família early in the day.
Watch out for pickpockets in busy tourist areas.
Wear comfy shoes — Rome has lots of cobbled streets.
Always carry a reusable water bottle; fountains are everywhere.
Apply sunscreen frequently — Cancun sun is strong.
Book excursions early to avoid last-minute price hikes.
Pack a light raincoat — Irish weather can be unpredictable.
Use contactless cards or Apple Pay for fast bus access.
Download offline maps of Hong Kong before you go.
Try the Octopus Card for cheap, easy transport.
Avoid drinking tap water; stick to bottled.
Use authorized taxis or apps like Uber for safety.
Lisbon is hilly — pack comfortable walking shoes.
Try the famous Pastel de Nata at local bakeries.
Respect local etiquette — bowing is a polite greeting.
Convenience stores have great, cheap meals.
Australia has strict customs — declare everything.
Remember the sun is strong; wear sunscreen daily.
